intro: Trimorpha kumaunensis, commonly known as the Kumaun bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, thriving in cool and moist environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
